main.title: Messaging
main.description: Messaging Building Block uses the electronic postbox embedded within systems, so people can access their messages in one place.
main.listDescription: Messaging Building Block allows you to:
main.listItem1: send email and text messages across various channels

section1.title: Centralised platform
section1.description: Contact the public through their chosen method of communication - whether that's email, text message or through the electronic postbox.

section2.title: Secure
section2.description: Messaging Building Block prioritises security to safeguard sensitive information and ensure compliance with data protection regulations.

section3.title: Reusable Templates
section3.description: Easily create templates for any type of communication (for example, confirmations, reminders and success notifications). This will ensure consistency and streamline your processes.

section4.title: Electronic Postbox
section4.description: Embedded within other systems, the electronic postbox allows users to easily access their messages and take action.

section5.title: Accessibility Compliance
section5.description: Messaging Building Block meets with accessibility regulations, Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, ensuring that all users can access and interact with messages.

section6.title: Dedicated Support
section6.description: Our team of experts is here to assist you every step of the way. Whether you have technical questions or need assistance with implementation, the dedicated support team ensures a smooth experience.

getStarted.title: Get started
getStarted.description: Ready to elevate your communication strategy? Contact us to schedule a demo and see how Messaging Building Block can transform how you engage with the public.

InactivePublicServant.title: Your account is under review
InactivePublicServant.description: Thanks for creating an account in the Building Blocks Ecosystem. Your account as a public servant has now been created.

paragraph.templates: Before you start, please ensure you have message templates ready to use. Navigate to <link>Message Templates</link> and create the message template you need. Templates allow you to use variables that draw information automatically from each individual addressee's data ensuring efficient messaging.
paragraph.recipients: You can set up and import a list of recipients to the recipient database. To do this go to <link>Service Users</link> in the main menu. You can send messages to one or more individual users by searching for, and selecting, each recipient. If the recipient you need is not in the database, you can add one before sending your message.

setupSteps.0: Click Send a message and select a template from the dropdown.
setupSteps.1: Review the template. Edit the template at the Message templates page if required.
setupSteps.3: Add recipients: Search for and choose one or more recipients from the database. If the user doesn't exist you can add them.
setupSteps.5: Schedule message: Send immediately or set a specific time and date.
setupSteps.6: Confirmation: Message sent or scheduled as specified.

button.sendAMessage: I'm ready, take me to Send a message

paragraph.main: To send a message, you must first create a template or select one from the options below. If no templates have been created, please visit the <href>Message Templates</href> section to get started.
paragraph.type: Please choose the type of message you wish to send

label.security: What is the difference between secured and non-secured messages?

details.security: When you send a secured message, the email is intercepted and the message content is sent to the recipient's secure Messaging mailbox. A default notification with a link to the secure message is sent by email to the recipient allowing them to log into Messaging using their MyGovID account. When you send a non-secure message the email is sent directly to the recipient.

paragraph.main:
Search for recipients by entering their name, surname and/or email address.
New recipients not in the database will be added automatically. Added recipients will appear in the list below.

error.database: An error occurred and the recipient was not added to the database. Please try again.

error.databaseFetch: An error occured when receiving the recipient(s).
error.timeout: It's taking longer than usual to import the user. Please check back in a few minutes.

success.add: {publicName} <{email}> has been successfully added to the recipients list.
